page.title: 05Tregartha Farm,Liskeard
page.content: Tregartha Farm(370 acres) is owned by the Martin family who live in the stone and slate farmhouse(built 1760). Four generations have farmed the land. 9 are employed to help with the mixed farming.While mechanization has made farming easier, 1980's economy has increased pressures.The largest field is 21 acres;the smallest is an orchard.The Martins have 55 Guernsey dairy cows,1 Charolais bull,111 young cattle,390 ewes,630 lambs,6 horses goats 19 chickens,5 cats and 5 dogs. Machinery includes 5 milking machines, 4 tractors,1 seed drill,1 combine harvester,1 manure spinner,1 potato picker,1 plough,1 buck rake,1 yard scraper,1 harrow,1 rotavator,1 sprayer,1 baler,1 trailer,1 hedge trimmer,1 power washer(for milking parlour),1 digger,1 roller,1 mower,1 forage harvester and 1 hay turner.
